## R Studio 
  
<ol>
  <li><strong>Guide to Using R</strong><br>
      A comprehensive guide for R beginners by <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/in/jared-adam-24b107241/" target="_blank">Jared Adam</a>:<br>
      <a href="https://jared-adam-psu.github.io/R-Tutorial-for-Tooker-Lab/" target="_blank">One code to rule them all (┛ಠ_ಠ)┛彡O</a><br>
      This tutorial helps streamline your R learning process, offering clear steps and examples.
  </li> 
 
  <li><strong>Codecademy: Learn R</strong><br>
      A helpful, free interactive tutorial to learn R from the basics:<br>
      <a href="https://www.codecademy.com/learn/learn-r?utm_source=pepperjam&utm_medium=affiliate&utm_term=159404&clickId=4716939938&pj_creativeid=8-12462&pj_publisherid=159404" target="_blank">Learn R with Codecademy</a><br>
      Start from the ground up and improve your R programming skills with hands-on practice.
  </li>

  <li><strong>R Markdown Documentation</strong><br>
      Learn to create professional reports, PDFs, and Word documents directly from R code using R Markdown:<br>
      <a href="https://rmarkdown.rstudio.com/lesson-1.html" target="_blank">R Markdown Documentation</a><br>
      This resource is great for integrating code with reports and presentations.
  </li>

  <li><strong>R Studio Graphing Notes</strong><br>
      A reference for creating visualizations and graphs using R Studio:<br>
      <a href="https://www.jeffdoser.com/files/for875/_book/" target="_blank">R Studio Graphing</a><br>
      This guide provides a deeper dive into R's graphing capabilities.
  </li>
</ol>

## Quarto Website Building

1. **How to Create a Quarto Website**  
   A YouTube tutorial showing how to build a website using RStudio, Quarto, and GitHub Pages. Learn how to integrate Quarto with GitHub Pages to host your site.
   <a href="https://youtu.be/YN75YXaLFGM?si=RyCG23IMBwFUKsO8" target="_blank">How to Create a Web Site Using Quarto, RStudio, and GitHub Pages</a>  
   
   <iframe width="560" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/YN75YXaLFGM" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>
2. Gallery showing different options for formatting a Quarto website: [Quarto Gallery](https://quarto.org/docs/gallery/)
3. Quarto documentation showing how to do a lot of the basics including website navigation, website search, and website tools: <a href="https://quarto.org/docs/websites/" target="_blank">Quarto - Creating a Website</a>

## Citations

1. **Zotero Citations Repository**  
   A collection of citation styles for use with Zotero, a free tool for managing references:  
   [Zotero Citations Repository](https://www.zotero.org/styles)  
   Use this to manage and generate citations for your research papers.

## Outdoors Stuff

1. **<a href="https://alpenflo.com/journal/how-to-check-for-snow-on-the-trail" target="_blank">How to check for snow on the trail</a>**  
I use this website in the spring to check to see which trails in the area are potentially snow free.

2. **<a href="https://deq.mt.gov/air/Programs/smokeforecasts" target="_blank">Montana Smoke Forecast</a>**  
This tells you how bad the smoke will be and for how long.

3. **<a href="https://www.first-nature.com/fungi/~id-guide.php" target="_blank">Fungi Identification Guide</a>**  
While it's basically impossible to ID a mushroom accurately without a gill print, I found this website helpful in at least narrowing down the specimen somewhat.

## Forest Service Roads

This website lets you download maps for the Cutster Gallatin National Forest. These maps reference when roads open in the spring and close in the fall. These maps are the Motorized Vehicle Use Maps (MVUMs).
